body: Straight the fuck up, ritos feedback system is beyond garbage.  YOUR TEAM CAN FUCKING FLAME WHOEVER THEY WANT BUT THE MOMENT YOU DEFNED YOURSELF OR YOUR TEAM MATES FROM A DOUCHE BAG, BOOM, YOURE FUCKING MUTED,SUSPENDED, BANNED. FUCKING RETARDED. LAZY FUCKING DUNTS MAN. FUCKING BROKEN ASS FEEDBACK SYSTEM BECAUSE OTHER PEOPLE WHO ARE JUST TRYING TO DEFEND THEIR TEAM MATES GET BANNED TOO. ITS FUCKING STUPID AND IDGAF if I lose all rights to using board which is also funny how they actually have a mod to watch this shit BUT READING FUCKING COMMS NONONO THATS TOO MUCH WORK. > LOOK AT ME, I RATHER MAKE A FUCKING BOT BAN ANYONE WHO SAYS THE WORD "%%%GOT" literally you get insta punished. fucking stupid. 

I'm gonna stop you right there. Both the League community and Riot have ZERO tolerance for that, regardless of context. That's never going to change, regardless of what you might consider more important.

As to the larger point, "defending yourself" isn't a thing. If you bumped your cart into someone at the supermarket and got into a screaming match with them, the manager isn't going to come ask which of you started it. He or she is simply going to ask you both to leave. That's just the reality of life as an adult.
Context should always matter, but that's my take.

You act like it's a simple problem that can be solved with just the snap of the finger. Unfortunately this is not the case. The behavioral systems have to make sure that someone is actually trolling before it can actually ban them. How does it find out about specific types of trolling? Through player-made reports. Obviously the system isn't perfect (there's always room for improvement with it) and players can sometimes slip through the cracks from time to time but gameplay trolls do get punished as well. In case you don't believe me [Here are](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/sU5wOfFJ-proof-that-the-automated-system-is-broken?show=rundown) two examples of gameplay trolls being banned. Yes it's just two examples, but it proves that they do get punished.

> this is the most retarded analogy that i have ever heard. how the fuck does bumping your cart into someone compare to getting harassed from trolls or getting reported multiple times from premades? as for "defending yourself", i'm from the old school. i'm not going to sit idle like a fucking pansy and cry about my feelings when my back is against the wall. you're getting a nice knuckle sandwich to the face.

Being harassed by trolls? Use the mute button on them or kill them with kindness.
A premade group troll reporting you? As long as you do nothing to actually validate their reports against you then you won't get in trouble and the reports will be thrown out.*
Accidentally bumped your shopping cart into someone at the store? Just apologize, see if they're okay and then just move on, or alert an employee or a manager if they're the ones who keep bumping into you on purpose.

None of these choices involve becoming a jerk and making everyone else around you miserable. More importantly none of these choices put yourself at risk of getting in trouble for poor behavior.

*From [Riot Tantram](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/H67KxUT6-about-chat-restriction?comment=000000000002): 

> Actually, Erdrik is correct here.

> A report flags a game for review. They do not establish guilt. The game is then reviewed for harassment, feeding, etc. This is why 'troll reporting' or 'gang reporting' do not work. False or inaccurate reports are thrown out.

> You cannot ever be punished for saying nothing .. unless of course it's for something gameplay related like feeding, afking or cheating. But, you can never be punished for offensive language, hate speech or verbal abuse if you said nothing.

> You act like it's a simple problem that can be solved with just the snap of the finger. Unfortunately this is not the case.

I've been playing since S2 myself as well (never been warned or banned though), and I'm well aware that toxicity has been around forever. Obviously as the game grows so too does its playerbase, but from what I've seen Riots ways of encouraging people to reform has actually gotten better over the years. Not only because the systems they've implemented since they started have gotten better (Tribunal was a good start, the Instant Feedback System improves on that system), but players also have more incentives to reform now than they did before with the implementation of Mystery Gifting and Hextech Crafting.

Now with that being said obviously the IFS could still be improved and yes Riot could still do a better job at helping people understand why they were punished. I just think it's silly to claim that Riot is doing nothing to help curb toxicity when we have proof that they are (i.e. numerous Riot posts on the subject, a dev blog discussing Prisoner's Island, multiple people complaining about their "unfair" punishments, etc.).

>even with the resources of a 1.5 billion net worth. you can probably create the most articulate security/toxicity control program with that money. but what's riot's priority? "TWO THOUSAND MORE REPORTS? NAH, GOTTA FINISH THESE BLOOD MOON SKINS SO WE CAN EXTORT MORE MONEY FROM THESE IMBECILES DURHUR". i know you can't fix things with a snap of a finger, but it's been happening for 5 years. that's half a fucking decade. if riot was an independent business, it would be in fucking shambles from the toxicity.

It's a common misconception that Riot has one team working on everything one at a time. This is untrue-the skins team is different from the player behavior team. Also, Riot is fully aware that there will always be people who only care about making others miserable, but they're also aware that people will have bad games from time to time.

> laughable and utter garbage examples. two examples compared to how many reports coming in? compared to how many trolls/feeders/afkers/flamers ruining our games? no wonder this game is the cancer that it is. what i'm more interested in is some actual fucking data that riot is actually working to solve this.

Also I read your ban complaint thread: you constantly called people autistic, claimed that someone had downs and just constantly whined and complained about your teammates using whatever insult you could think of whenever they did something you didn't like. It doesn't take a genius to tell that that kind of behavior is definitely punishment worthy, and whether or not a premade reported you is purely coincidental and nothing more.

Riot, the company who has a proven track record with player behavior and is actually working on ways to improve their PB systems.

A banned troll rager who is more interested in raging and dismissing evidence than they are at actually improving the system or their behavior.
